business.headline: India lifted 171 million people from extreme poverty from 2012 to 2022: World BankRural extreme poverty dropped from 18.4 per cent to 2.8 per cent, and urban from 10.7 per cent to 1.1 per cent, narrowing the rural-urban gap from 7.7 to 1.7 percentage points.

Changing jobs? Check this EPFO update on PF transfersEffective January 2025, the requirement for employer approval in most transfer cases has been eliminated. Previously, PF balance transfers required coordination between source and destination EPFO offices, often causing delays.

E-commerce, crops, data storage top India-US trade deal negotiations: ReportDiscussions will now begin on issues such as market access for US farm goods, India's data localisation rules, and the role of big tech in e-commerce—areas that have previously proved politically sensitive in India.

Indian airlines may face turbulence as Pakistan closes its skiesPakistan has announced shutting its airspace to Indian carriers as tensions rise between the two neighbours following a deadly militant attack in Indian Kashmir earlier this week.

Samsung to invest Rs 1,000 crore in Tamil Nadu plant: ReportSamsung's Tamil Nadu factory currently employs over 2,000 people. In 2022–23, the plant contributed one-fifth of Samsung's Rs 1 lakh crore sales in India.
Sensex, Nifty close lower as rising India-Pakistan tension spooks investorsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 588.80 points to end at 79,212.53, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 207.35 points to end at 24,039.35.

Pahalgam terror attack casts big shadow on Kashmir's booming tourism economyKashmir was slowly rebuilding its image as a peaceful tourist destination after years of conflict, especially after the abrogation of Article 370 in August 2019.

Sebi revises cut-off timings for overnight mutual fund redemptions. Details hereSebi aims to make sure stock brokers and clearing members use client funds wisely by investing in secure overnight mutual fund schemes (MFOS).

Air India may buy 10 Boeing planes turned down by China: ReportThe ongoing trade tensions between the US and China, marked by steep duties above 100%, have impacted various sectors, even the aviation industry has taken a hit.
Pakistan Stock Exchange portal crashes amid rising geopolitical heatThe online portal of PSX showed a message saying "We'll be back soon," indicating that the website was temporarily unavailable.

Bengaluru resident shares costly homebuying mistake: 'Don't fall for FOMO'A social media user from Bengaluru shared that he has been living in Bengaluru for the past six years. Like many others, he moved to the city for better career opportunities. Despite being financially stable, he chose to rent rather than buy a flat. But the trouble started soon after.

Sensex, Nifty tank: Indo-Pak tensions trigger market crash. Check top losersSensex plunged over 1,000 points, while Nifty tanked over 300 points, falling below 24,000 as uncertainty prevailed over geopolitical tensions.

entertainment.headline: Karthik Subbaraj on why romance is the soul of Suriya's RetroDirector Karthik Subbaraj, known for films like 'Pizza' and 'Jigarthanda', is shifting focus to romance in his latest venture 'Retro'. Starring Suriya, the film delves into love's transformative power against a vintage gangster backdrop.

AR Rahman, Ponniyin Selvan 2 makers face Rs 2 crore fine in copyright caseThe Delhi High Court has intervened in a copyright dispute involving composer A R Rahman and the film 'Ponniyin Selvan 2'. The court found Rahman's song identical to the Junior Dagar Brothers' Shiv Stuti.

Content creator Misha Agarwal dies two days before 25th birthdayInfluencer Misha Agarwal has passed away just days before her 25th birthday, leaving her followers and family in shock. The cause of her death is yet to be revealed.

Karisma sent people to spy on Raveena's look: Andaz Apna Apna designer AshleyThe beloved cult classic 'Andaz Apna Apna' returns to cinemas, bringing back memories for costume designer Ashley Rebello, who reminisces about creating iconic looks for the film's stars. He recounted a behind-the-scene anecdote before the shoot of the song 'Yeh Raat Aur Yeh Doori'.

Dan Da Dan S2 trailer promises more full-throttle action, quirk. WatchThe new trailer for Dan Da Dan's second season delves into the intense battle between Okarun and the possessed Jiji, promising an action-packed continuation. With familiar faces returning to the creative team, the series is set to stream from July 3 on Netflix and Crunchyroll.

Ground Zero Day 1: Emraan Hashmi film starts slow at Rs 1 croreGround Zero, starring Emraan Hashmi, had a slow start at the box office with a collection of Rs 1 crore on its opening day. The film, produced by Excel Entertainment, chronicles the story of BSF officer Narendra Nath Dhar Dubey's operation against terrorist mastermind Ghazi Baba.

Martin Scorsese 'glad' to join Neeraj Ghaywan's Homebound as executive producerFilmmaker Martin Scorsese has joined Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' as an executive producer. The film will premiere at the 2025 Cannes Film Festival in the Un Certain Regard section.

BTS members Jin, Namjoon enjoy Coldplay concert in Seoul, hint at BTS reunionBTS members Jin and Namjoon attended Coldplay's concert in Seoul on April 25, creating a buzz on social media. The duo hinted at a BTS reunion, delighting fans worldwide.

Rajinikanth flies economy class, fans call him 'ever-humble superstar'Actor Rajinikanth took fans by surprise when he boarded an IndiGo flight in economy class, sparking excitement among passengers. The superstar greeted fans warmly, leading to a viral moment captured on video.

Illiterate idiot: Adnan Sami blasts ex-Pak minister for questioning citizenshipThe exchange between Adnan Sami and Fawad Hussian started after the Pakistani leader referred to a direction by Home Minister Amit Shah asking states to ensure the prompt return of Pakistani citizens.

Shubhangi Atre on ex-husband Piyush Poorey: Alcohol addiction destroyed himActor Shubhangi Atre opens up about her divorce from her late ex-husband, Piyush Poorey, who passed away due to liver cirrhosis, emphasising the impact of his alcohol addiction on their family and her decision to prioritise their daughter's well-being.
Shreya Ghoshal cancels Surat concert after Pahalgam attackSinger Shreya Ghoshal and organisers cancel Surat concert after Pahalgam attack. Full refunds have been assured to ticket holders.

Emraan Hashmi calls Adolescence-style show in India a 'logistical nightmare'Emraan Hashmi recently revealed the challenges of producing a show like 'Adolescence' in India, citing its unique format and logistical hurdles.

Bullet Train Explosion review: Spiritual sequel that combines heart and heatReleased-Wed Apr 23, 2025Bullet Train Explosion: The Netflix film is a gripping thriller that focuses on the everyday heroes aboard a rigged Shinkansen and outside of it, rather than the perpetrator's motive. Directed by Shinji Higuchi, the film pays tribute to Japan's railway staff, blending tension with humanity.

Kesari 2 dialogue plagiarised from a poem? Poet shares proofKesari Chapter 2 faces allegations of plagiarism as YouTuber and poet Yahya Bootwala accused the film's writer of copying lines from his poem on 'Jallianwala Bagh' without permission. He shared the proof on social media.

Crazy casting, crazier pairing: How OTT is heralding a bold new chapterOTT platforms are breaking casting norms wide open—bringing underrated actors and wild on-screen pairings to centre stage. On Cinematic Saturday, we are diving deep into the casting revolution you didn't see coming.

Next vacation will be in Kashmir: Suniel Shetty's fearless stance amid attackActor Suniel Shetty encourages citizens to visit Kashmir for their next vacation to boost tourism and counterterrorism, following a deadly attack in Pahalgam.  He emphasises unity and resilience as key responses to fear and hatred.

David Muir honoured at TIME100 Gala, recalls moment with late Pope FrancisDavid Muir was honored at the 2025 TIME100 Gala for his impactful journalism. He reflected on his early career, praised mentors like Diane Sawyer, and will lead ABC's Vatican coverage.

What's coming and going on CBS: 2025–26 renewals, cancellations, and new showsCBS's 2025–26 schedule features renewed hits like NCIS and Ghosts, the end of Blue Bloods and FBI spin-offs, and exciting new entries like Boston Blue and CIA.

general news.headline: Another terrorist's house blown up as anti-terror ops intensify after J&K attackSecurity forces have intensified anti-terror operations in Jammu and Kashmir, demolishing properties linked to terrorists, following the deadly Pahalgam attack which killed 26 people, including tourists.

Gunmen shoot at 43-year-old man near his home in Jammu and Kashmir's KupwaraThe civilian, identified as Gh Rasool Magray, received bullet injuries to his abdomen and left wrist. He has been shifted to a nearby hospital for treatment.

They didn't recognise...: Omar Abdullah on Pak's probe offer into PahalgamJ&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah pointed out that Pakistan had initially denied the Pahalgam incident and accused India of 'staging' it.

Fear grips India-Pak border as post-Pahalgam escalation threatens fragile peaceThe Pahalgam terror attack has shattered the fragile peace along the Line of Control, leaving residents dreading a return to the violence of the past.

When can India turn off Pakistan's tap completely?India put on hold the Indus Waters Treaty after the Pahalgam massacre. Eighty percent of Pakistan's farm fields depend on water from the Indus system. With the current infrastructure, India can at best store a portion of the water from flowing into Pakistan. Several projects have been planned to harness the Indus system. How long will it take for India to turn Pakistan's taps off completely if it wanted to?

Maybe Putin doesn't want to stop Ukraine war, he's just tapping me along: TrumpHours after meeting Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Rome, Donald Trump accused Russia's Vladimir Putin of prolonging the Ukraine conflict, warning Moscow may have no intention of ending the war.

80 hours and 3 meetings on, BSF jawan still in Pakistan Rangers custodyA Border Security Force (BSF) constable, identified as Purnam Kumar Shaw, accidentally crossed the International Border in Punjab's Ferozepur sector on Wednesday afternoon.

Exclusive: Bengal man shares photos of 'Pakistani bhaiya' with guns, detainedA young man from West Bengal posted photos of himself with people holding firearms on social media, captioned "Pakistani bhaiya".

Viva il Papa: Leaders, royals, and pilgrims bid final farewell to Pope FrancisWorld leaders and people from across the world bid farewell to Pope Francis on Saturday. The Argentine pope, who reigned for 12 years, died at the age of 88 on Monday after suffering a stroke.

Water will become scarce along with food: BJP's Anurag Thakur slams PakistanAmid soaring tensions, Anurag Thakur warned Pakistan of an impending water crisis after India suspended the Indus Waters Treaty, intensifying pressure following the deadly Pahalgam terror attack.

Pak's Shehbaz Sharif breaks silence amid tensions: Prepared for any misadventurePakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif said he was ready for a 'neutral and transparent investigation' into the Pahalgam terror attack that left 26 civilians dead.

Pakistan takes 'emergency' steps for pharma supplies after India halts tradePakistan has initiated "emergency" measures to secure pharmaceutical supplies in response after the suspension of trade ties with India following the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack.

Crazy casting, crazier pairing: How OTT is heralding a bold new chapterOTT platforms are breaking casting norms wide open—bringing underrated actors and wild on-screen pairings to centre stage. On Cinematic Saturday, we are diving deep into the casting revolution you didn't see coming.

Jagan Reddy okayed liquor policy for party funds, prime accused 'confessed'A remand report accessed by India Today has linked the proceeds of the Rs 3,200-crore Andhra liquor scam to YSRCP leaders, alleging that former Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy approved an excise policy designed to funnel revenue to his party.

Video: Pak official makes throat-slitting gesture at Indian protesters in LondonA senior Pakistani Army official mocked Indians protesting against Pahalgam terror attacks - drawing ire from netizens, with many calling the act 'sick,' 'disgusting' and a 'stark reminder of the lack of civility among Pakistan's military and diplomatic figures.'

8 killed, over 700 injured in suspected chemical blast at Iran portThe blast occurred as Iran began a third round of nuclear talks with the United States in Oman, although the cause of the explosion was not immediately clear.

Pet obesity is on the rise. Where are hoomans going wrong?For true pet parents, life revolves around keeping their furry friends happy and healthy. But if meals aren't portioned to match their needs, you might unknowingly be putting them at risk of obesity.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Iranian woman travelling in van stranded after Attari border shut, seeks PM's helpAn Iranian tourist stranded at the Attari border after the India-Pakistan land route closure has appealed to Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

Trump says India, Pak fought for 1,000 years. Internet says nice trySoon after Trump's remarks started doing the rounds, several social media users took to X and blasted the US President. 'He's so embarrassing,' said one user while another joked, 'No one knows more about the Kashmir conflict.'

Toughest man in India? Sukant Singh Suki runs 350 km race in 4 daysMumbai's Sukant Singh Suki became the first Indian to complete three 200-mile ultramarathon races in the world. After his latest run at the Delirious West race in Australia, Suki spoke to IndiaToday.in, narrating his journey, the inspiration and the future of endurance running in India.

In videos: Powerful blast rips through Iran port, impact felt 10 km awayIran blast: Videos showed glass windows being blown out of buildings miles away from the epicentre of the explosion in Iran's Bandar Abbas. Over 500 people were injured in the blast.

Either our water will flow or their blood: Bilawal Bhutto on Indus treaty freezeThe remarks by Bilawal Bhutto-Zardari signals that India's punitive actions, including the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, after the Pahalgam attack have infuriated Pakistan.

Government order due to security concerns: Court rejects Pak woman's visa pleaThe Delhi High Court on Friday dismissed a Pakistani national's petition challenging the revocation of her visa, citing national security concerns following the government's suspension of visa services for neighbouring country.

sports.headline: Novak Djokovic retiring soon? Ex-World No.1 drops subtle hint after Madrid exitNovak Djokovic said that he might not return to play next year in the Madrid Open after losing to Matteo Arnaldi in straight sets on Saturday at Manolo Santana.

Rain plays spoilsport as Kolkata's playoff chances take massive hitIPL 2025, KKR vs PBKS: Rain made sure that the match between Kolkata Knight Riders and Punjab Kings on Saturday at the Eden Gardens was called off.

Former India assistant coach Nayar amongst mentors for T20 Mumbai League 2025Former India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar is amongst the mentors to be named for the upcoming season of the Mumbai T20 League 2025. Nayar is currently working as a part of the KKR coaching setup.

Ravi Bishnoi not bothered by competition pressure for India spotIPL 2025, MI vs LSG: In the pre-match press conference, young leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi shrugged off the pressure of constant competition for spots in the Indian national team.

Devdutt Padikkal has taken bull by the horn and done exceedingly well: RCB coachRCB assistant coach Malolan Rangarajan has said that Devdutt Padikkal has taken the bull by the horn and has done exceedingly well in IPL 2025. Padikkal has scored 230 runs in 8 matches for Bengaluru this season.

IPL 2025: Massive sandstorm hits KKR vs PBKS clash at Eden GardensA fierce sandstorm followed by heavy rain brought chaos to the IPL 2025 clash between KKR and PBKS at Eden Gardens, halting the match just one over into Kolkata's run-chase of 202.

KKR, PBKS stars don black armbands to honour Pahalgam terror attack victimsPlayers from Kolkata Knight Riders and Punjab Kings showed heartfelt solidarity during their IPL 2025 clash by donning black armbands to honour the victims of the recent terror attack in Pahalgam, Kashmir.

Djokovic's poor 2025 run continues after first round exit in MadridMadrid Open 2025: Novak Djokovic crashed out of the tournament after Italy's Matteo Arnaldi defeated him 6-3, 6-4, in the Round of 64 on Saturday, April 26.

Hardik Pandya is enjoying cricket: Kieron Pollard praises MI skipper after comebackMI coach Kieron Pollard heaped praise on Hardik Pandya for his comeback in IPL 2025 after being criticised and trolled last season after assuming the captaincy of the team. Pollard said that Hardik is enjoying his cricket at the moment.

KKR vs PBKS: Glenn Maxwell makes return as Rovman Powell handed Kolkata debutGlenn Maxwell has made a return to the Punjab Kings after missing the last two games while Kolkata Knight Riders handed a debut to Rovman Powell for the clash. PBKS won the toss and opted to bat first.

Shreyas Iyer nostalgic on Kolkata return for KKR clash: Another day to embraceShreyas Iyer spoke emotionally about returning to Eden Gardens, admitting he felt a wave of nostalgia as he faced his former side KKR for the first time at the venue since moving to Punjab Kings in IPL 2025.

KKR, PBKS stars don black armbands to honour Pahalgam terror attack victimsPlayers from Kolkata Knight Riders and Punjab Kings showed heartfelt solidarity during their IPL 2025 clash by donning black armbands to honour the victims of the recent terror attack in Pahalgam, Kashmir.

Djokovic's poor 2025 run continues after first round exit in MadridMadrid Open 2025: Novak Djokovic crashed out of the tournament after Italy's Matteo Arnaldi defeated him 6-3, 6-4, in the Round of 64 on Saturday, April 26.

Hardik Pandya is enjoying cricket: Kieron Pollard praises MI skipper after comebackMI coach Kieron Pollard heaped praise on Hardik Pandya for his comeback in IPL 2025 after being criticised and trolled last season after assuming the captaincy of the team. Pollard said that Hardik is enjoying his cricket at the moment.

KKR vs PBKS: Glenn Maxwell makes return as Rovman Powell handed Kolkata debutGlenn Maxwell has made a return to the Punjab Kings after missing the last two games while Kolkata Knight Riders handed a debut to Rovman Powell for the clash. PBKS won the toss and opted to bat first.

Shreyas Iyer nostalgic on Kolkata return for KKR clash: Another day to embraceShreyas Iyer spoke emotionally about returning to Eden Gardens, admitting he felt a wave of nostalgia as he faced his former side KKR for the first time at the venue since moving to Punjab Kings in IPL 2025.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
